alert.note: Alert for Hancock; Washington (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 19 at 2:48PM EDT by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of DownEast Maine, including the following counties, Hancock and Washington. * WHEN...Until 645 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 248 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain. Overflowing poor drainage areas will cause minor flooding in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Ellsworth, Bar Harbor, Bucksport, Calais, Blue Hill, Machias, Lubec, Eastport, Cherryfield, Danforth, Vanceboro, Deer Isle, Dedham, Jonesport, Castine, Steuben, Harrington, Perry, Pembroke and Princeton. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
